article:
{{Infobox given name
| name = Lee image = imagesize = caption = pronunciation = gender = Unisex
| meaning = Shelter region = nickname = origin = Old English, Gaelic, Celtic.
| related names = Leigh, Lea, some Leah footnotes = Can originate from non-
| english languages, with alternate meaning
}}

'Lee' is a unisex given name meaning "shelter". It is derived from the surname
Lee (English name) and a place name meaning "sheltered from the storm" in Old
English. [http://www.mfnames.com/mfnames/l/origin-and-meaning-of-lee.htm
MFnames.com - Origin and Meaning of Lee] [http://www.all-babynames.com/meaning-of-name-
Lee.html]

Its popularity in the United Kingdom peaked during the 1970s and 1980s, when it
was frequently among the top 20 male names, but had fallen out of the top 100 by
2001. [http://www.babynames.co.uk/meaning_origin_name_Lee.htm] In the
United States, its popularity as a male first name occurred in the 1890s and as
a female first name in the 1950s. Lee is also common as a middle name.

Lee is also a diminutive form of the given names Ashley, Beverly, Kimberley, and
Leslie. It also has a separate origin as a Hebrew name () and term of endearment
meaning "mine".
